definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: He was living under an assumed name.
sentences.chinese: 他過着隱姓埋名的生活。

sentences.english: Q. Are you ready to change your life and not be able to walk in the street incognito ?
sentences.chinese: 你準備好改變你的生活並且隱姓埋名的在街上走麼？

sentences.english: The names of workers at the site have been changed to protect their identities.
sentences.chinese: 爲保護其研究員身份，工作人員已經隱姓埋名。

sentences.english: The reason for keeping personal names secret is that one's name can be used in sorcery.
sentences.chinese: 隱姓埋名的原因也許是名字被用於巫術。

sentences.english: I just wanted to be a ghost, completely anonymous.
sentences.chinese: 我只想像一個孤魂一樣，完完全全地隱姓埋名。

definition: to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
an execution/to put sb to death
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
